parameters: Use the switches below to activate or desactivate
the conditional lights of this room.
The switch on the left allow you to change
the colors of the crystal's light (be sure
to activate them first to see the difference).
The switch on the right will reset the lights
of this room to their initial state.
Use the switch below to activate or desactivate the
conditional lights of this room.
Light off 2
Light on 2
Light off 1
Light on 1
Light on 2
A
If you active the 'Kill Switch Auto' parameter,
conditional lights events will have their kill switch
locked to ON(OFF) if their corresponding light is
activated/deactivated.
You can use this difference to give alternate
apparences to these events, like it is done in
this room.
You can also make use of the kill switch
on the light activator events like the
two bottom switches of this tower do.
\P[1] is on the wrong side of the stone
and therefore can not read what is written!
Daynight speed 0
Tint set #333333
Regionblock 60 on #000000
To create a conditional light, had an ID at the end
of the notetag of any light. For example, in the
notetag <cl: light 150 #e4e809 1>, '1' is your ID.
Use the plugin commands 'Light on ID' and
'Light off ID' to activate or desactivate
the conditional light. In our example, 'Light on 1'.
Multiple events can have the same ID. They will all
turn on or off at the same time.
\P[1] is on the wrong side of the stone
and therefore can not read what is written!
In this demo and by default, conditional lights carry
over on map change. If you prefer to automatically
desactivate conditional lights while changing map,
you can set to ON the 'Reset Light' plugin parameter.
You can also do it manually with the
'Light switch reset' plugin command.
\P[1] is on the wrong side of the stone
and therefore can not read what is written!
The plugin commands 'Light color ID COLOR' allows
you to change the color of a conditional light.
It works even if the light is currently off.
If COLOR is set to 'defaultcolor' (without the
quotes), it will reset the light back to its
initial color.
\P[1] is on the wrong side of the stone
and therefore can not read what is written!
Light color 1 #008c46
A
Light color 1 defaultcolor
A
Light switch reset
Light on 2
Lights resetted to their default state.
